{{URL| http://www.adamcarolla.com | AdamCarolla.com}} Adam Lakers Carolla(born May 27, 1964) is anUnited StatesAmericancomedian, radio personality, television host, actor, podcaster and director. He hostsThe Adam Carolla Show (podcast)The Adam Carolla Show, a talk show distributed as apodcastwhich set the record as the "most downloaded podcast" as judged byGuinness World Recordsin 2011.

Carolla co-hosted the syndicated radio call-in programLovelinefrom 1995 to 2005 as well as the show's television incarnation onMTVfrom 1996 to 2000. He was the co-host and co-creator of the television programThe Man Show(19992004), and the co-creator and a regular performer on the television showCrank Yankers(20022007). He hostedThe Adam Carolla Project, ahome improvementtelevision program which aired onTLC (TV channel)TLCin 2005 andThe Car ShowonSpeed TVcite webhttp://www.speedtv.com/programs/the-car-show/The Car ShowFox Sports digitalSpeedtv.comNovember 27, 2012in 2011.

Carolla has also appeared on the networkReality television#Reality competition/game showsreality television programsDancing with the Stars (U.S. season 6)Dancing with the StarsandThe Apprentice (U.S. season 12)The Celebrity Apprentice. His bookIn Fifty Years We'll All Be Chicksdebuted onThe New York TimesThe New York Times Best Seller listBest Seller listin 2010, and his second book,Not Taco Bell Material, also reached New York Times bestseller status.cite newsTaylorIhsanhttp://www.nytimes.com/best-sellers-books/2012-07-01/hardcover-nonfiction/list.htmlBest Sellers - The New York Times[[The New York Times]]November 27, 2012

An outspoken commentator on various social, political, and religious issues, Carolla has made numerous guest appearances on political talk shows, ranging fromBill Maher'sReal Time with Bill MahertoBill O'Reilly (political commentator)Bill O'Reilly'sThe O'Reilly Factor, on which he headlines the weekly segmentRollin' with Carolla.
article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: Adam Carolla was born inNorth Hollywood, Los Angeles, California.cite webhttp://www.familytreelegends.com/records/calbirths?cCalifornia Births, 1905 - 1995Familytreelegends.comMay 27, 1964February 3, 2014http://www.lamag.com/guide/media/the-adam-carolla-show/His father, Jim Carolla, was a psychologist of Italian heritage, and his mother, Kris (ne McCall), was of Irish heritage.cite webAdam Carollaethnicelebshttp://ethnicelebs.com/adam-carollaThe two separated when Adam was young.cite bookCarollaAdamAdam CarollaIn Fifty Years We'll All Be Chicks: and Other Complaints from an Angry Middle-aged White Guyhttps://books.google.com/?idMarch 21, 20121st paperbackMay 17, 2011[[Three Rivers Press]]978-0-307-71738-22A Little Bit About the AuthorI grew up in Los Angeles's San Fernando Valley in the seventies. I was the product of separation. I would have been the product of divorce but divorce includes filling out paperwork and paying a county clerk sixty bucks to file it.Carolla was not given a middle name by his parents; on his driver's license application he listed his middle name as "Lakers" as a joke. The application was processed without notice, and the name still appears as Adam Lakers Carolla to this day.cite newsYou won't believe Adam Carolla's middle nameHoppesLynn[[ESPN]]June 17, 2010http://espn.go.com/espn/page2/index?idMarch 15, 2012http://www.webcitation.org/66BsTzSayMarch 15, 2012nocite webhttp://adamradio.wordpress.com/2006/02/16/adam-with-mark-burnett-rick-fox-finesse-mitchell/Adam with Mark Burnett, Rick Fox, Finesse MitchellFebruary 16, 2006August 10, 2008The Official Adam Carolla Show Bloghttp://www.webcitation.org/66Bt6WcA4March 15, 2012noHis maternal step-grandfather was screenwriterLszl Grg (writer)Lszl Grg, who wroteThe Mole People (film)The Mole People.cite webhttp://www.lamag.com/features/2007/10/01/inside-the-revved-up-pissed-off-brain-of-adam1Features - Los Angeles magazineLamag.comMarch 16, 2013February 3, 2014

Adam was raised in theNorth Hollywood, Los AngelesNorth Hollywoodsuburb of Los Angeles. He attended Colfax Elementary School,Walter Reed Middle SchoolWalter Reed Junior High, andNorth Hollywood High School. Carolla did not receive his high school diploma until years later as it was held by the school until a library fine was paid.cite episodeApril 1, 2003LovelineLovelineApril 1, 2003Carolla can be seen paying off the book and receiving his diploma in an episode of his 2005 television show,The Adam Carolla Project.cite webNail in the Head (episode 8)http://www.tv.com/shows/the-adam-carolla-project/nail-in-the-head-554041/[[TV.com]]March 15, 2012http://www.webcitation.org/66BvBr0fIMarch 15, 2012

During his earlier years, Carolla playedPop Warner Little ScholarsPop WarnerAmerican footballfootballfor seven years; he later suggested that being involved in sports saved him from a chaotic home life.cite webhttp://adamradio.wordpress.com/2006/10/11/adam-with-kurt-busch-shawn-merriman-and-mistress-melissa/Adam with Kurt Busch, Shawn Merriman and Mistress MelissaOctober 11, 2006The Official Adam Carolla Show BlogFebruary 20, 2007https://web.archive.org/web/20070220082736/http://adamradio.wordpress.com/2006/10/11/adam-with-kurt-busch-shawn-merriman-and-mistress-melissa/During his senior year at North Hollywood High School, Carolla distinguished himself in football. article.heading: Radio
article.paragraph: In 1994, Carolla volunteered his services as a boxing trainer to prepareJimmy Kimmelfor a bout being staged byKROQ-FM's morning radio programKevin and Bean.cite webAdam Carolla (bio)http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0004805/bio[[Internet Movie Database]]March 14, 2012http://www.webcitation.org/66A5EBmWiMarch 14, 2012noKimmel was a regular on the show as "Jimmy the Sports Guy" and he was set to fight another KROQ personality in a boxing exhibition which was being billed as the "Bleeda in Reseda."cite webJimmy Kimmel biohttp://jimmykimmel.net/jkbio.htm[[Jimmy Kimmel]]March 13, 2012http://www.webcitation.org/668nJ29eBMarch 13, 2012noCarolla parlayed this opportunity into a long-running friendship and business partnership with Kimmel as well as a recurring role onKevin and Beanas cranky woodshop teacher, Mr. Birchum.cite newsInfinity Launches FREE FM as Stern Replacement Strategyhttp://creativemac.digitalmedianet.com/articles/viewarticle.jsp?idMarch 13, 2012[[Infinity Broadcasting Corporation]]October 26, 2005http://www.webcitation.org/668nkNOuRMarch 13, 2012
article.heading: Loveline
article.paragraph: In October 1995, after being signed to theWilliam Morris EndeavorWilliam Morris AgencybyMark Itkin,cite webhttp://adamcarolla.com/store/StoreAdamcarolla.comFebruary 3, 2014Carolla was offered the job of co-hosting the radio call-in showLoveline.His co-hosts were the physicianDrew Pinsky("Dr. Drew") andRiki Rachtman. Carolla received the offer after Pinsky heard him onKevin and Bean(Rachtman left the show the following year.)cite newshttp://www.mndaily.com/sites/default/files/paper-pdfs/1996/08/09/1996-08-09.pdfLaying it on the LovelineCowanMichaelAugust 9, 1996March 13, 2012[[Minnesota Daily]]March 13, 2012http://www.webcitation.org/668iyAWfiyesLoveline is broadcast onKROQ-FMin Los Angeles and is syndicated nationwide on theWestwood One (19762011)Westwood Oneradio network.

While the format of the program was primarily a call-in show where listeners would ask questions about sex and relationships, Carolla would often spend much of the show ranting about various topics, from fart jokes to extended parodies of radio morning shows, including mocking the format's penchant for useless and repetitive weather and traffic reports. In contrast to the reserved, thoughtful Pinsky, Carolla served as the loud, funny side of the show. Carolla's character was described by one reviewer as "a toned-down version ofHoward Sternminus the huge ego."On September 25, 2001 Carolla and Jimmy Kimmel both had filled in for Howard Stern's head writerJackie Martlingafter Martling's departure from the show in March 2001. Carolla had mentioned in various interviews and on his podcast that he was offered the job to replace Jackie Martling, but turned it down primarily due to Stern's show being located in New York as well as his commitment to Loveline.

article.heading: The Adam Carolla Podcast
article.paragraph: MainThe Adam Carolla Show (podcast)Carolla started a daily podcast on February 23, 2009, at his personal website, which would evolve into theACE Broadcasting Network. The first Adam Carolla podcast was downloaded more than 250,000 times in the initial 24 hours, and by the third podcast, it was the number one podcast on iTunes in both the U.S. and Canada.cite webhttp://www.edibleapple.com/the-adam-carolla-podcast-jumps-to-1-spot-on-itunes-in-1-day/"The Adam Carolla Podcast" jumps to No. 1 spot on iTunes in 1 dayFebruary 7, 2009Edible AppleDecember 6, 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20101226111922/http://www.edibleapple.com/the-adam-carolla-podcast-jumps-to-1-spot-on-itunes-in-1-day/26 December 2010noDuring the debut week, the Adam Carolla podcast recorded 1.6 million downloads. In the second week it recorded 2.4 million downloads. By the fourth episode of the second week, featuring formerThe Adam Carolla Show (terrestrial radio)Adam Carolla ShowsidekickDave Dameshek, the show was downloaded more than 500,000 times.cite newsGetting the ax – it's awesomeStein, J.http://www.latimes.com/news/opinion/la-oe-stein6-2009mar06,1,1953463.columnLos Angeles TimesMarch 6, 2009June 7, 2013Adam stated thatBandwidth (computing)bandwidthcost more than $9,000 a month as of May 2009.Loveline, May 12, 2009

At the end of 2009, The Adam Carolla Podcast was selected by iTunes for its end-of-the-year awards as the Best Audio Podcast of 2009.cite webPaulIanhttp://www.pcworld.com/article/185663/itunes_picks_the_best_of_2009.htmliTunes Picks the Best of 2009PCWorld.comDecember 31, 2009October 10, 2011On May 18, 2011, Adam announced onJimmy Kimmel Live!that The Adam Carolla Show has taken theGuinness World Recordfor the most downloaded podcast ever fromRicky Gervaiscite webhttp://www.digitalspy.com/celebrity/news/a320520/adam-carolla-show-breaks-podcast-world-record.html'Adam Carolla Show' breaks podcast world record â€“ Celebrity NewsDigital SpyMay 19, 2011September 22, 2011after receiving 59,574,843 unique downloads from March 2009 to March 16, 2011.Guinness World Records (2011)."'The Adam Carolla Show' breaks record for most downloaded podcast". Retrieved May 22, 2011.

In a case that has been referred to aspatent trolling, patent holding companyPersonal Audio LLC (Patent holding company)Personal Audiois currently suing, among others, Adam Carolla,cite webhttp://www.networkworld.com/community/blog/patent-trolls-may-soon-suffer-death-blow-thanks-podcastersNetwork WorldNeagleColinMay 5, 2013Network World Patent trolls may suffer a death blow, thanks to podcastersNetwork World5 March 2013claiming a patent on "an audio program and message distribution system in which a host system organizes and transmits program segments to client subscriber locations".cite webhttps://www.eff.org/sites/default/files/us8112504.pdfSystem for Disseminating Media Content Representing Episodes in a Serialized ContextU.S. Patent 8,112,504 B24 March 2013
article.heading: Television
1999 through 2004
article.paragraph: Carolla began his first original television series withThe Man Show, along with partner and close friendJimmy Kimmel, onComedy Centralfrom 1999 to 2003. He leftThe Man Showat the same time as Kimmel, after having been reportedly offered $50,000 per episode to stay on. Carolla has continued his work with Kimmel as a writer and guest onJimmy Kimmel Live!. He also appeared on an episode ofSpace Ghost Coast to Coastaround this time.

Carolla and partnerDaniel Kellisonare the heads ofJackhole Productions. The two created the television showCrank Yankersfor Comedy Central, which revived the Mr. Birchum character. (The show premiered in 2002 on Comedy Central and returned to MTV2 on February 9, 2007, running again until March 30, 2007. The show screened in Australia on SBS Television and The Comedy Channel between 2003 and 2008.)
article.heading: 2005 through 2008
article.paragraph: From August 2005 to November 2005, Carolla hosted the talk showToo Late with Adam Carollaon Comedy Central.

Also in 2005, Carolla was featured in a home remodeling program calledThe Adam Carolla Projectwherein he and a crew of old friends renovated his childhood home. The 13 episodes aired on the cable channel TLC (The Learning Channel) from October through December 2005. The house was then sold for 1.2 million dollars.cite newshttp://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?fAdam Carolla selling TV series houseNovember 20, 2005February 21, 2008RyonRuthSan Francisco Chroniclehttps://web.archive.org/web/20080404164939/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f4 April 2008nocite webhttp://epguides.com/AdamCarollaProject/The Adam Carolla ProjectAugust 10, 2008epguides.comhttps://web.archive.org/web/20080809124701/http://www.epguides.com/AdamCarollaProject/9 August 2008no
In 2006, Carolla appeared on the special summer seriesGameshow Marathon (US TV series)Gameshow Marathonas a celebrity panelist on theMatch Gameepisode.

On the February 18, 2008 broadcast of his radio show, Carolla announced that he would be one of the contestants on the next season ofDancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)Dancing with the Stars. Later in the broadcast, it was revealed to Adam that his partner would beJulianne Hough.cite webhttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20178686,00.html?iidDancing With The Stars announces lineupFebruary 18, 2008February 20, 2008BrunoMikeEW.comHe was voted off on the April 8, 2008 episode after his performance of thePaso Doble, after incorporating a demonstration of unicycle riding in his dance routine.

article.heading: 2009 to present
article.paragraph: On February 21, 2009, a day after his Los Angeles-based morning radio show was canceled  as part of a format change at KLSX-FM  CBS ordered a comedy pilot starring the actor/comedian.Ace in the Holewas to star Carolla as a husband and father who works as a driving instructor. Carolla created and wrote the pilot with Kevin Hench ("Jimmy Kimmel Live!").cite newshttp://www.variety.com/article/VR1118000437Adam Carolla gets CBS pilotMichaelSchneiderFebruary 21, 2009VarietyCarolla stated thatPamela Adlonwas to play his wife andWindell Middlebrooksof the Miller High Life commercial fame will play his best friend. During his March 30, 2009, podcast, Carolla briefly described the show as being "All in the Family, essentially", with Carolla playing a similar role to that ofArchie Bunker. On the July 23, 2009, episode of the Adam Carolla Podcast, Carolla announced that CBS was not picking up the pilot for the 2009 season, "in any way, shape or form."

On October 22, 2009, it was reported inVarietythat Carolla had struck a deal with NBC to produce a half-hour pilot for a sitcom. The report was later confirmed on January 4, 2010, and was the first comedy pilot ordered by NBC for the season.cite newshttp://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE6040D820100105ReutersNBC picks up Adam Carolla pilotJanuary 5, 2010The untitled project, written by Carolla and Kevin Hench, was a single-camera endeavor that starred Carolla as a contractor and father who attempts to rebuild his life after his wife leaves him.Andreeva, Nellie (AP) (October 13, 2010)."NBC picks up Adam Carolla pilot". HollywoodReporter.com.cite newshttp://www.variety.com/article/VR1118013310.html?categoryidVarietyAdam Carolla lands NBC pilotMichaelSchneiderJanuary 4, 2010Carolla was set to executive produce the NBC project along with frequent collaborators Kimmel and Hench, as well as his agent James "Babydoll" Dixon, Jon Pollack from30 Rock, Gail Berman, Daniel Kellison, and Lloyd Braun. Universal Media Studios, BermanBraun, and Carolla and Jimmy Kimmel's own Jackhole Industries.

On the February 13, 2010 episode of Carolla's CarCast podcast, he broke the news that The History Channel had picked upTop Gear US, which NBC had decided against in 2008.cite webhttp://www.adamcarolla.com/CarCastBlog/2010/02/13/adams-miura/Adamâ€™s Miura | CarCastAdamcarolla.comFebruary 13, 2010September 22, 2011On the March 26, 2010, episode of CarCast, Carolla said that he would not be co-hostingTop Gear USbecause of scheduling conflicts with his NBC sitcom project. In June 2010, Carolla said that his NBC pilot had not been picked up and was now "dead."cite webBaconCalebhttp://laist.com/2010/06/11/adam_carolla_talks_about_talking.phpAdam Carolla Talks About Talking And PieLastJune 11, 2010September 22, 2011

Premiering on February 19, 2012, Carolla was also one of the contestants in the 12th season ofNBC'sThe Apprentice (U.S. season 12)The Celebrity Apprentice. He was fired in Week 4, because Mr. Trump perceived that Carolla did not utilize Andretti's car background during a Buick presentation, even though it was clear that Andretti did not like public speaking.

Carolla's''The Car Show''debuted on Speed TV July 13, 2011. Appearing Wednesdays at 10 pm Eastern, it featured Carolla as the host, along withDan Neil,John Salley, and Matt Farah. It had a format similar toTop Gear (2002 TV series)Top Gear, mixing car reviews, tests and humor. The show was initially met with largely positive reviews from car enthusiasts and comedy fans. Talk show host and comedianJay Lenocalled The Car Show, "...a lot of fun.""The Tonight Show with Jay Leno Adam Carolla Part 2"dead linkFebruary 2014(video). DailyMotion.com. Event occurs at 3:33.The Car Show was cancelled after one season, after undergoing format changes due to low ratings, as Carolla mentioned on his podcast January 13, 2012.

Carolla's latest book isDaddy, Stop Talking!: And Other Things My Kids Want but won't be Getting,in which he uses the meme of modern parenting as a general theme for his humorous insights into modern life. Carolla spells out what adults must do if they dont want to have to support their kids forever. Using his own childhood as a cautionary tale, and touting the pitfalls of the kind of helicopter parenting so pervasive today.
article.heading: Controversies
article.paragraph: Carolla has occasionally stirred up controversy due toHasty generalizationsweeping generalizationsabout various groups, usually presented in a comedic light. article.heading: Religious and political views
article.paragraph: Regarding his religious beliefs, Carolla has stated, "I am not agnostic. I amAtheismatheist. I don't think there is no God; I know there's no God. I know there's no God the same way I know many other laws in our universe. I know there's no God and I know most of the world knows that as well. They just won't admit it because there's another thing they know: they know they're going to die, and it freaks them out.
